entityId.localType: State Library of Western Australia Call Number

nameEntry.part: Sister Kate's Child and Family Services Private Archives

biogHist.abstract: Sister Kate's Child and Family Services Private Archives is a collection of records held in the Battye Library's Private Archives Collection at the State Library of Western Australia. The collection contains a range of records, some which are restricted to protect people's privacy. The items in this collection include personal and administration records and audio-visual material. There are some records for: Parkerville Children's Home; Sister Kate's Children's Cottage Home, Queen's Park; Sister Kate's Child and Family Care Services; and Manguri. There may also be admission and other information about people who were at the following Homes: Applecross Cottage, Ardross House, Greenmount Hostel, Hamilton Hill Hostel, Maddington Scatter Cottage, Yokine Cottage, and the Nollamara Children's Respite Home.
biogHist.p: The Sister Kate's Child and Family Services Private Archives collection contains a range of archival series, some which are restricted. The records in this collection include:

list.item: Admission registers (restricted access) 9 April 1940 to 17 November 1954; and then from 1 January 1956 to 23 September 1982
Child endowment and child welfare records (restricted access) 1944 to 1951
Bankbooks for the Children's Cottage Home and Sister Kate's Memorial Fund, various dates from 1946 to 1951
Various administration items from Manguri Corporation, 1988 to 2002
Financial statement (1984) and financial records, 1992 to 2002
Legal documents, Minutes and plans, statistics and reports, 1992 to 2002

biogHist.p: The State Library of Western Australia has prepared a finding aid (known as a Manuscript Note or MN) that provides more detail about the contents of the Sister Kate's Child and Family Services Private Archives collection and the restrictions governing access to some of these records.

Access Conditions
Many of the records relating to people who have been in out of home care are restricted to protect the privacy of individuals, but there are also many items of interest which are open to the public. Please see the Manuscript note for MN 957, or contact the State Library of Western Australia.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: State Library of Western Australia - Contact Details
Uniting Church (Synod of Western Australia) Archives, Records (1918 - 1980s)

descriptiveNote.p: Sister Kate's Child and Family Services was, for some years, managed by the Uniting Church of Australia and a small amount of other archival items relating to Sister Kate's are held in the Uniting Church archival collection.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Sister Kate's Child and Family Care Services (1980 - 1988)

descriptiveNote.p: A copy of the Constitution of the Western Australian Indigenous Child Care Agencies Council which includes Djooraminda, Yorganop and Manguri is held in the Sister Kate's Child and Family Services Private Archives at the State Library of Western Australia.

A copy of the Constitution of the Western Australian Indigenous Child Care Agencies Council which includes Djooraminda, Yorganop and Manguri is held in the Sister Kate's Child and Family Services Private Archives at the State Library of Western Australia.
